commit_message:
WIP:Specification for using cache as a resource using cache allocation support
with resource director technology and resource monitoring daemon.

Change-Id: I6d25c3e48833f7cc917103ada5ec6f82a42b8342
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/75/502575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================= Last Level Cache as a Resource with RDT ======================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cache-as-a-resource-with-rdt Nova currently does not have mechanism to use Last Level Cache (LLC) as a schedulable resource similar to CPU or Memory.Intel Resource Director Technology (RDT) enables controlling LLC per workload basis by means of Cache Allocation Technolgoy (CAT). Cache associations per workload are controlled via associating workload with construct called cache ways that divide LLC on each socket into equal chunks of fixed size and constructing a Cache Bit Mask (CBM) called Class of Service (COS). Although the application of CAT is fairly simple scaling the workloads with the limited amount of LLC per socket on a host platform needs to consider multiple aspects to meet the required Quality of Service (QoS) like assigning isolated versus overlapping COS for workloads, dividing LLC in to tiered classes for varying QoS, dynamically construct CBMs at schedule time, among others. For scheduling purposes Nova needs a simple way to know cache availability at schedule time, mechanism to address various QoS and method to assign isolated versus overlapping cache ways. We propose to update scheduler code to interact with Resource Management Daemon (RMD), open source software that communicates using REST API, to provide cache availability using hospitality score for new workloads based on current workload occupancy and mechanism to provide various QoS policies while exposing cache as a resource. Problem description =================== Last Level Cache (LLC) (or simply cache) is a shared hardware resource between physical CPUs of a socket on a host.In a platform collocated with multiple workloads, instances can act as noisy neighbors to each other.For example a high priority latency sensitive workload is adversely affected in performance when a low priority workload consumes most of the LLC leaving less room for latency sensitive workload to use LLC effectively.Real time monitoring and control is required to help achieve optimal perfromance for the workload of interest. Intel Resource Director Technology (RDT) provides cache to be used to as a controllable resource to be associated with a set of CPUs on a socket or with a set of processes executing on a socket using Cache Allocation Technology (CAT).This is made possible via associating workload with construct called cache ways that divide LLC on each socket into equal chunks of fixed size cache and constructing a Cache Bit Mask (CBM) on per socket node basis. Exisiting solutions that use Intel Resource Directory Technology (RDT) that help associate cache ways to a workload falls short of providing control of LLC at hardware time scales which is crucial for meeting required Service Level Assurance (SLA). Monitoring and analyzing the per host cache level statistics on a remote node, calculate appropriate decision and channeling an appropriate action to the host of interest would consume quite a few time cycles that exceed far behind hardware time scale. There is a high chance that the validity of such actions would be made unsable for resources like cache for workloads that are performance sensitive. Adding to the complexity, the cache footprint and utilization per workload would differ based on the platform generation and configuration. Orchestrators currently dont have a comprehensive methodology to control/allocate resources like cache at hardware time scale. Although CAT provides isolated or overlapping cache ways constructs using CBM, its difficult for Nova to consider multiple combinations of cache ways sharing per host basis at schedule time. Resource Management Daemon (RMD) is an open source daemon that runs on individual hosts with pluggable interfaces to interact with orchestration using REST API, monitoring layer using collectd or IPCs and enforcement layer using libpqos or resctrl file system. RMD contains intellignece to process a resource policy from orhcestrator and do the required resource adjustments in real time. The orchestrator policy could be constructed with a specific Service Level Objective (SLO) to avoid problems like nosiy neighbor scenarios or to guarantee a SLA. RMD would in turn provide mechanisms to optmize cache usage using either isolated or overlapping based cache associations. RMD partitions host's cache ways into 3 cache pools: * `Graranteed`: allocate fixed amount of cache ways for an instance. * `BestEffort`: allocates a guaranted minimum and try allocate towards a fixed maximum cache ways for an instance. * `Shared` : all instances assigned in this cache pool will have their LLC share with each other. TODO: Provide some reference URL for RMD Use Cases --------- Communications service providers that care about NFV deployments require resiliency from nosiy neighbors with strict throughput and latency requirements. A very important way to meet the SLOs would be to have a set of cache ways associated with workload of interest [1]_. A public cloud operator would care about monetizing cache as a resource and gurantee an SLA at same time. Having interfaces with a local daemon that helps achieve this would be an invaluable addition to the existing hardware resource set. Proposed change =============== There are 2 aspects change we need to consider: * Cache resource management with placement api. * Interactions with RMD. We will add two new extra spec fileds in flavor: * `max_cache`: Indicates maximal cache ways of the instance could be used by an instance, per socket basis. * `min_cache`: Indicates minimum number of cache ways could be used by an instance, per socket basis. A workload could use combination between `max_cache` and `min_cache`: * max_cache == min_cache > 0 : Static and fixed allocation, allocate cache ways from `Guaranteed` pool. * max_cache == min_cache == 0 : No cache ways allocated, add this instance into `Shared` cache pool, shared cache ways with other instances. * max_cache > min_cache > 0 : Allocate cache from `BestEffort` pool, try to allocate cache ways as many as `max_cache`, but ensure the instance can have guaranteed `min_cache` ways. How to schedule on a host based on LLC? --------------------------------------- There are lots of combinations for `max_cache`, `min_cache`. RMD can not report all resource left on the host for all the combinations. To support this combinations of `max_cache`, `min_cache`, use RMD's hospitality score API to query if that `host` welcome this `max_cache`, `min_cache` request of instance or not. But this requires scheduler to query the compute node on the air to get the hospitality score of selected hosts. There will be some overhead, but it's very much flexible for user to define different `max_cache`, `min_cache` in the flavor. And by using hospitality score API, placement-api don't not need to maintain cache resource usage. Nova compute can query RMD API to provide number of resources can be supported in eache cache resource pool. They are all linear resource in each of the pools, havig no overlap with each other, and so they can be maintained by placement-api. ** Interactions with RMD ------------------------ RMD provides unix socket and TCP socket, nova can choose each of it to send cache resource query and cache enforce/release operation. There will be some modification on nova-compute code to directly talk with a local RMD process. And nova-scheduler will need to talk with each compute node's RMD, or through the RPC method of nova-compute Alternatives ------------ There are some other options for each aspect: ** Cache resource management with placement api Alternatives option: Use cache tier in extra spec in flavor, instead of `max_cache`, `min_cache`. The tier definition will be done in configuretion file of RMD. e.g: * gold, max_cache = min_cache = 4 : 2 * silver, max_cache = 4, min_cache = 2 : 3 * bronze, max_cache = min_cache = 0 : 10 This is not very flexible if end user requires different `max_cache`, `min_cache`, but it will be easy for RMD to report resource counts in each cache pool on the host and easy to map resource module into placement-api. This requires nova-compute to query RMD API to get how many resource for each tier of cache can be supported in eache cache resource pool, then report to placement-api. They are all linear resource in itself pool, no overlap with each other, so they can be maintained by placement-api easily. How to report cache resource: RMD exports an API so nova can query to get how many resource left in each resource pool on each cache id, then report to placement-api. e.g. : * gold, max_cache = min_cache = 4 : 2 * silver, max_cache = 4, min_cache = 2 : 3 * bronze, max_cache = min_cache = 0 : 10 ** Interactions with RMD Option 1: Integrate with nova libvirt driver or just libvirt to make this feature a driver specific, but we need to consider that the developmenet cycle if we want this feature first to integrated into libvirt first. Options 2: Develop a RMD nova plugin(provided by RMD) to proxy the requests to placement-api and nova-api, the plugin will report resource usage of the host and listen to instance creation/deletion notification from Nova. Then grab instance and flavor information from nova public api, trigger enforcement or release of cache to RMD. Pros: there is not much modification required in nova. Cons: nova will not be aware of the cache enforcement failures as it tries to reschedule. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- End user will define new extra spec in flavor when try to use cache allocation for instances. Besides, RMD need to be configured on nova compute host. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Eli Qiao(eliqiao) sunku ranganath(sunku-ranganath) Work Items ---------- TODO... Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Add unit test cases. Documentation Impact ==================== Some devref content should be written. References ========== .. [1] Whitepaper "Deterministic NFV with Intel RDT" provides example of cache usage scenarios for optimal performance: "https://builders.intel.com/docs/networkbuilders/deterministic_network _functions_virtualization_with_Intel_Resource_Director_Technology.pdf" History =======

'api-ref/source/v2/ext-backups-actions-v2.inc', 'api-ref/source/v2/volumes-v2-types.inc', 'api-ref/source/v3/os-vol-pool-v3.inc', 'api-ref/source/v3/volume-manage.inc', 'api-ref/source/v2/ext-backups.inc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a96fad9f3bf01d8482edec6d1a5e3bfa3389df03', 'message': 'Fix api-ref response code title levels

Using the wrong character resulted in the wrong title level
being used for the response codes, which in turn caused the
"detail" show/hide toggle to not be able to hide all of the
per-endpoint details. This corrects these to be at the correct
level.

Also ran into issues after changing them where sphinx was not
happy with the random title levels. This appears to be due to
the order processed and whether not earlier included files had
all subsequent levels. Adding an additional title in our first
included file resolved that problem.

Change-Id: I19405778980310f2d6d06eb7b23102f74a3d6e03
Closes-bug: #1755566
'}]
commit_message:
Fix api-ref response code title levels

Using the wrong character resulted in the wrong title level
being used for the response codes, which in turn caused the
"detail" show/hide toggle to not be able to hide all of the
per-endpoint details. This corrects these to be at the correct
level.

Also ran into issues after changing them where sphinx was not
happy with the random title levels. This appears to be due to
the order processed and whether not earlier included files had
all subsequent levels. Adding an additional title in our first
included file resolved that problem.

Change-Id: I19405778980310f2d6d06eb7b23102f74a3d6e03
Closes-bug: #1755566

commit_message:
py3: port cli form_signature and unit tests

This patch ports the form_signature cli `swift-form-signature`
and it's corrisponding tests to py3.

In essence in Py3 the HMAC function expects binary strings.

Change-Id: I5dded4ceb80f0cc595403775e8f9c17873e1e37b

commit_message:
[Draft] Implement overhead control in OSProfiler

Add sampling rate, limit trace level to OSProfiler

Related blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/osprofiler/+spec/osprofiler-overhead-control

Change-Id: Ia6a901718668d54732842e5063532f9c7540f944
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/80/406880/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, build the docs using tox, or see: http://rst.ninjs.org The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo?searchtext=awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. For specs targeted at a single project, please prefix the first line of your commit message with the name of the project. For example, if you're submitting a new feature for oslo.config, your git commit message should start something like: "config: My new feature". Wrap text at 79 columns. Do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None If you would like to provide a diagram with your spec, ascii diagrams are required. http://asciiflow.com/ is a very nice tool to assist with making ascii diagrams. The reason for this is that the tool used to review specs is based purely on plain text. Plain text will allow review to proceed without having to look at additional files which can not be viewed in gerrit. It will also allow inline feedback on the diagram itself. ============================== Overhead control in OSProfiler ============================== Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/osprofiler/+spec/osprofiler-overhead-control Currently, OSProfiler do not have any overhead control mechanism. Sampling rate and overhead control had been stated in previous specification [1] by boris-42. However, this feature is not implemented yet. Problem description =================== In production, if we use OSProfiler for tracing requests, it should be turned on all the time*. Turning it on all the time can help ops to find slowness and problems in system quickly. However, OSProfiler running all the time may not be a good idea because of overhead that it can be made (CPU time, network I/O). From that point of view, we should implement a mechanism to handle overhead. Sampling rate, trace stack limit should be implemented and estimate data size of a trace. \* This mean that we trace every request, not only when we want to. Proposed change =============== 1. Sampling rate should be implemented to reduce number of trace requests. This idea comes from how other tools sampling data, such as zipkin [2] and opentracing.io [3]. * Sampling in range from 0 to 2^128 - 1 (max size of uuid4 to integer) * or, reduce range to smaller range. For example, 0 to 2^64 - 1 (maxint). 2. Limit trace stack to specific level. Instead of tracing requests in deep level, we can trace to level 2 or 3 only (for example) to reduce number of trace requests. Sometimes, level 2 or 3 is enough to know where the problems occur. 3. With simple trace, size of a trace may vary and around 0.6K to 1K bytes depends on type of trace. With each type of trace, we can decide to choose suitable sampling rate. Performance Impact ------------------ Sampling rate may cause some extra comparisons with uuid4 (in range 0 to 2^128 - 1). However, it can reduce a lot of traces. Configuration Impact -------------------- Add new config for sampling rate Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: * tovin07 Other contributors: * Work Items ---------- 1. Implement sampling rate 2. Limit trace level with trace stack 3. Measure trace size to choose suitable sampling rate and reduce overhead Dependencies ============ None Documentation Impact ==================== Add document section for this feature. References ========== * [1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/mitaka/osprofiler-cross-service-project-profiling.html#performance-impact * [2] https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin/src/main/java/zipkin/collector/CollectorSampler.java * [3] http://opentracing.io/documentation/pages/api/data-conventions.html .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add horizon to requirements file.

Change-Id: I63a753d78eef2938e74b29802f81369607db4d1d

commit_message:
Fix installing Horizon from src for tox env

After this patch [1] is merged into openstack/requirements, we cannot
use pip to install Horizion from src with the upper-constraints. We're
going to rely on the requirements of Horizion instead, and another run
of pip install will also go with the upper-contraints after Horizon is
installed.

Tox env deps is also updated to follow the changes introduced by another
patch [2], but tox_install.sh is still kept for installing Horizion.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550475/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061/

Change-Id: I41042e5cedffe5793ef7af3ee5e3bf3d0577e87b
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix tests using O_TMPFILE

Unit tests using O_TMPFILE only rely on the kernel version to check
for the feature. This is wrong, as some filesystem, like tmpfs, doesn't
support O_TMPFILE.

So, instead of checking kernel version, this patch actually attempts to
open a file using O_TMPFILE and see if that's supported. If not, then
the test is skipped.

Change-Id: I5d652f1634b1ef940838573cfdd799ea17b8b572

commit_message:
Clean out config deprecation information

Nova settings were deprecated, then removed in change
Ic112a68101c0dcb14da0db06c62ae190474a37d9. Some legacy
info was left behind in one of the new options referring
to the old config setting that should now be removed.

Change-Id: I031e5ffbc11c4b044f3baf808d852ce871a2d6c5

commit_message:
Set rgw_keystone_revocation_interval to 0 for ceph-ansible

Ceph RGW defaults to checking every 600 seconds for a revocation.
This is only useful for PKI tokens. PKI is not enabled.
This check needs to be disabled.

Change-Id: I9d87ff5226ab55df05e68f6639e6679fb0566484
Closes-Bug: #1748137
(cherry picked from commit 05b8f5ef67b98d9fc284835c9411c40ead8cf095)

commit_message:
Update minimum acceptable version for ovsdbapp to 0.10.0

The version 0.10.0 includes a fix for a bug that can lead to database
inconsitencies between Neutron and networking-ovn.

Related-Bug: #1754291
Change-Id: Ic54df57fddfa4ff965162d02b4549b2efd8f7093

commit_message:
Update sample data with simpler values

This change updates the LDAP sample data to use simpler values for the
cases of testing and basic setup of keystone backed by LDAP.

Depends-On: I1aeccffc018d0fcefc8e2b15a4ac6b83cb2be8b6
Change-Id: I7a34bfb099f8028970764c8acf3195fdf601e562

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Copyright 2017 The Openstack-Helm Authors. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -xe #NOTE: Handle LDAP make pull-images ldap #NOTE: Deploy command : ${OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS:=""} helm upgrade --install ldap ./ldap \ --namespace=openstack \ --set pod.replicas.server=1 \ --set manifests.job_load_data=true \ ${OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS} \ ${OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_LDAP} #NOTE: Wait for deploy ./tools/deployment/common/wait-for-pods.sh openstack #NOTE: Validate Deployment info helm status ldap #NOTE: Handle Keystone make pull-images keystone #NOTE: Deploy command : ${OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS:=""} helm upgrade --install keystone ./keystone \ --namespace=openstack \ --values=./tools/overrides/keystone/ldap_domain_config.yaml \ ${OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS} \ ${OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_KEYSTONE} #NOTE: Wait for deploy ./tools/deployment/common/wait-for-pods.sh openstack #NOTE: Validate Deployment info helm status keystone export OS_CLOUD=openstack_helm sleep 30 #NOTE(portdirect): Wait for ingress controller to update rules and restart Nginx openstack endpoint list #NOTE: Do some additional queries here for LDAP openstack domain list openstack user list openstack user list --domain ldapdomain openstack role add --user bob --project admin --user-domain ldapdomain --project-domain default admin #NOTE: Doing a final check to make sure the ldap-backed domain user can be used to get token. openstack --os-username bob --os-password Bob --os-user-domain-name ldapdomain --os-identity-api-version 3 token issue

commit_message:
Return nested parameters for resource group.

This refactors the building of schema from parameter validation to use a
new method (which doesn't keep stacks in memory), and use that new
method for providing proper schema for resource group when the size is
0.

Change-Id: Id3020e8f3fd94e2cef413d5eb9de9d1cd16ddeaa
Closes-Bug: #1751074
Closes-Bug: #1626025
(cherry picked from commit 9f73a232d766a3d7f3baac149c587db99b92aa81)

deleted_lines: # Note preview_resources is needed here to build the tree # of nested resources/stacks in memory, otherwise the # nested/has_nested() tests below won't work stack.preview_resources() def nested_params(stk): n_result = {} for r in stk: if stk[r].has_nested(): n_params = stk[r].nested().parameters.map( api.format_validate_parameter, filter_func=filter_parameter) n_result[r] = { 'Type': stk[r].type(), 'Description': stk[r].nested().t.get( 'Description', ''), 'Parameters': n_params } # Add parameter_groups if it is present in nested stack nested_pg = parameter_groups.ParameterGroups( stk[r].nested().t) if nested_pg.parameter_groups: n_result[r].update({'ParameterGroups': nested_pg.parameter_groups}) n_result[r].update(nested_params(stk[r].nested())) return {'NestedParameters': n_result} if n_result else {} result.update(nested_params(stack))

commit_message:
Subnet segment_id writable extension

To enable the possibility to migrate a non-routed network to a
routed network allow updating the segment_id of a subnet.

Change-Id: Iffda823a149a1143f46ee9a05e9640b34bf42c51
Partial-Bug: #1692490

subject: Fix API reference attach_mode parameter default for attachments API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-13 19:04:52.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v3/parameters.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/5b83e38daf6843b2ceee825417b2bc155c72525d', 'message': 'Fix API reference attach_mode parameter default for attachments API

The default attach_mode for volume attachments is "rw", as can
be seen from looking at the VolumeAttachment.finish_attach method
and VolumeManager.attachment_update method. The REST API itself
does not set or return a default attach_mode, it's all set in the
data model when the attachment is 'completed' by assigning a host
connector.

Change-Id: I1e41e93bd534d830311a653eb16fef89a2d8431a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix API reference attach_mode parameter default for attachments API

The default attach_mode for volume attachments is "rw", as can
be seen from looking at the VolumeAttachment.finish_attach method
and VolumeManager.attachment_update method. The REST API itself
does not set or return a default attach_mode, it's all set in the
data model when the attachment is 'completed' by assigning a host
connector.

Change-Id: I1e41e93bd534d830311a653eb16fef89a2d8431a

commit_message:
[install] Mentions SQL max connection error

It is worth mentioning about the maximum number of
connections error messages to give hints how to deal
with such kind of errors.

Change-Id: Iee67650c97c40db49a1ee23ea4015d25ec380978
Closes-Bug: #1749681

added_lines: .. note:: If you see ``Too many connections`` or ``Too many open files`` error messages, verify that maximum number of connection settings are well applied to your environment. In MariaDB, you may also need to change `open_files_limit <https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/server-system-variables/#open_files_limit>`__ configuration.

commit_message:
Remove duplicate declaration of rpc_response_timeout

RPC client option "rpc_response_timeout" is registered as
a part of oslo_messaging config [1]. The existing option in
mistral's config just duplecates it, which leads to two
equal options in the generated sample config.

To prevent this we can remove the related registration in
mistral without hesitation.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/rpc/client.py#L41-L45

Change-Id: Ie1856ab6308a4d53584a5829251078961e886f05

subject: Set rgw_keystone_revocation_interval to 0 for ceph::rgw::keystone

Ceph RGW defaults to checking every 600 seconds for a revocation.
This is only useful for PKI tokens. PKI is not enabled. This check
needs to be disabled.

Closes-Bug: #1748137
Change-Id: I2487ce8e5cb5d3dc0d7fb8e547a4abe0e086ff4b
(cherry picked from commit 9aa495d8abdd96d47533c37a0009cfe74533f276)
'}]
commit_message:
Set rgw_keystone_revocation_interval to 0 for ceph::rgw::keystone

Ceph RGW defaults to checking every 600 seconds for a revocation.
This is only useful for PKI tokens. PKI is not enabled. This check
needs to be disabled.

Closes-Bug: #1748137

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add horizon to requirements file.

Change-Id: Ife1aa2df08181fb7d7fcc00fdc225c92425fe6c8

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add horizon to requirements file.

Change-Id: I114221774cf0e76774e9abfa26852fe3e9f8cb5d

commit_message:
Fix binding:profile parameter type in API reference

The port binding:profile is a dict, as noted in the
parameter description and related samples, so this fixes
the parameter type from 'string' to 'object'.

Change-Id: Iddd3415cedac18327045e2fd8070d157c48e1bb4

commit_message:
Rearrange cell mapping tasks

Existing instances can be mapped to a newly created cell immediately
after the cell is created and by the same conductor host that created
the cell.

After a new compute host is built, it will need to mapped to a cell
through the 'discover_hosts' command of nova-manage. This command will
still need to be run against a host that has direct database access, but
the command is able to handle mapping of all compute hosts that do not
currently belong to the cell so it only needs to be run once per play.

There can be a short delay in the time between a compute service
starting and becoming available to be discovered and mapped but, for
most deployments, compute host discovery will be handled automatically
as a periodic task.

Conflicts:
>------tasks/main.yml

Change-Id: I4f7328e1aff79eb94f278999b97fbad8f44c6a3e
Closes-Bug: 1749037
Related-Bug: 1729661
Related-Bug: 1752540
(cherry picked from commit 6321cf90304023c20dc6abb87e2fa20107b7051d)

without spending effort on primary partitions. The object replicator

commit_message:
Add handoffs-only mode to DB replicators.

The object reconstructor has a handoffs-only mode that is very useful
when a cluster requires rapid rebalancing, like when disks are nearing
fullness. This mode's goal is to remove handoff partitions from disks
without spending effort on primary partitions. The object replicator
has a similar mode, though it varies in some details.

This commit adds a handoffs-only mode to the account and container
replicators.

Change-Id: I588b151ee65ae49d204bd6bf58555504c15edf9f
Closes-Bug: 1668399
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/97/545497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # The handoffs_only mode option is for special-case emergency # situations such as full disks in the cluster. This option SHOULD NOT # BE ENABLED except in emergencies. When handoffs_only mode is enabled # the replicator will *only* replicate from handoff nodes to primary # nodes and will not sync primary nodes with other primary nodes. # # This has two main effects: first, the replicator becomes much more # effective at removing misplaced databases, thereby freeing up disk # space at a much faster pace than normal. Second, the replicator does # not sync data between primary nodes, so out-of-sync account and # container listings will not resolve while handoffs_only is enabled. # # This mode is intended to allow operators to temporarily sacrifice # consistency in order to gain faster rebalancing, such as during a # capacity addition with nearly-full disks. It is not intended for # long-term use. # # handoffs_only = no

A keystone only controller deployment

A very basic deployment to be used with free-ipa, and upgrade ci.
There may be other valuable uses for this deployment as well.

commit_message:
novajoin: Optionally configure kerberos

This enables the puppet module to optionally create a minimal kerberos
configuration. This is specially useful when running novajoin inside a
container, since when running with SELinux enabled, we sometimes cannot
load the the kerberos configuration from the host due to some includes
pointing to /var/lib.

Change-Id: I554125fd6b48e620370f9e3a6061bbdc1d55b0ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/66/551866/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Facter.add(:ipa_server) do confine kernel: 'Linux' setcode do if File.exist?('/etc/ipa/default.conf') Facter::Util::Resolution.exec('grep xmlrpc_uri /etc/ipa/default.conf | cut -d/ -f3') end end end

commit_message:
glance-api: add dependency on message bus

without this the api starts up in a non-working state, the bootstrap
job then runs and give is images which are stuck queued

commit_message:
Refine waiting for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

In change Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4, we stopped waiting
for vif plug events during hard reboot and start, because the behavior
of neutron plug events depended on the vif type and we couldn't rely on
the stale network info cache.

This refines the logic not to wait for vif plug events only for the
bridge vif type, instead of for all types. We also add a flag to
_create_domain_and_network to indicate that we're in the middle of a
reboot and to expect to wait for plug events for all vif types except
the bridge vif type, regardless of the vif's 'active' status.

We only query network_info from neutron at the beginning of a reboot,
before we've unplugged anything, so the majority of the time, the vifs
will be active=True. The current logic in get_neutron_events will only
expect events for vifs with 'active' status False. This adds a way to
override that if we know we've already unplugged vifs as part of a
reboot.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022 and
I13de970c3beed29311d43991115a0c6d28ac14e0 are the source of the above
conflicts in driver.py. The first removed encryptor attach logic from
_create_domain_and_network in Queens while the second altered the
signature of _create_domain_and_network in Queens, removing reboot that
is then reintroduced with this change.

Related-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib08afad3822f2ca95cfeea18d7f4fc4cb407b4d6
(cherry picked from commit aaf37a26d6caa124f0cc6c3fe21bfdf58ccb8517)
(cherry picked from commit 5a10047f9dd4383f6ec9046d392f26c93f8420d4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/48/542748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver._get_neutron_events') @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver.plug_vifs') @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver._lxc_disk_handler') @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver._create_domain') def test_create_domain_and_network_reboot(self, mock_create, mock_handler, mock_plug, mock_events): # Verify that we call get_neutron_events with reboot=True if # create_domain_and_network was called with reboot=True drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) instance = objects.Instance(**self.test_instance) network_info = _fake_network_info(self, 1) @mock.patch.object(drvr.firewall_driver, 'setup_basic_filtering') @mock.patch.object(drvr.firewall_driver, 'prepare_instance_filter') @mock.patch.object(drvr.firewall_driver, 'apply_instance_filter') def _do_create(mock_apply, mock_prepare, mock_setup): drvr._create_domain_and_network(self.context, mock.sentinel.xml, instance, network_info, reboot=True) _do_create() mock_events.assert_called_once_with(network_info, reboot=True) block_device_info=block_device_info, reboot=True) def test_get_neutron_events_reboot(self): drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) bridge = network_model.VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE ovs = network_model.VIF_TYPE_OVS network_info = [network_model.VIF(id='1'), network_model.VIF(id='2', active=True), network_model.VIF(id='3', type=bridge), network_model.VIF(id='4', type=ovs)] events = drvr._get_neutron_events(network_info, reboot=True) self.assertEqual([('network-vif-plugged', '1'), ('network-vif-plugged', '2'), ('network-vif-plugged', '4')], events)

Refine waiting for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

In change Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4, we stopped waiting
for vif plug events during hard reboot and start, because the behavior
of neutron plug events depended on the vif type and we couldn't rely on
the stale network info cache.

This refines the logic not to wait for vif plug events only for the
bridge vif type, instead of for all types. We also add a flag to
_create_domain_and_network to indicate that we're in the middle of a
reboot and to expect to wait for plug events for all vif types except
the bridge vif type, regardless of the vif's 'active' status.

before we've unplugged anything, so the majority of the time, the vifs
will be active=True. The current logic in get_neutron_events will only
expect events for vifs with 'active' status False. This adds a way to
override that if we know we've already unplugged vifs as part of a
reboot.

commit_message:
Refine waiting for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

In change Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4, we stopped waiting
for vif plug events during hard reboot and start, because the behavior
of neutron plug events depended on the vif type and we couldn't rely on
the stale network info cache.

This refines the logic not to wait for vif plug events only for the
bridge vif type, instead of for all types. We also add a flag to
_create_domain_and_network to indicate that we're in the middle of a
reboot and to expect to wait for plug events for all vif types except
the bridge vif type, regardless of the vif's 'active' status.

We only query network_info from neutron at the beginning of a reboot,
before we've unplugged anything, so the majority of the time, the vifs
will be active=True. The current logic in get_neutron_events will only
expect events for vifs with 'active' status False. This adds a way to
override that if we know we've already unplugged vifs as part of a
reboot.

Related-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib08afad3822f2ca95cfeea18d7f4fc4cb407b4d6

commit_message:
Don't validate local_link_connection when port has client-id

Infiniband ports do not require the local_link_connection field to be
populated as the network topology is discoverable by the Infiniband
Subnet Manager.

This change removes the requirement for local_link_connection for
Infiniband ports. Infiniband ports have a client-id in their extra
field.

Closes-Bug: #1753222
Change-Id: I2bfac4ccaf825bd9aa8ea0d2b447fcd7767acbc5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/96/548396/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note(moshele): Client-id in the port extra indicate # InfiniBand port. In this case we don't use local_link_connection # because the configuration is done by OpenSM. if port.extra.get('client-id'): return True

commit_message:
Add a warning to user: Unable to remove availability zone from host aggregate

Because the nova API does not allow to set aggregates an empty
availability_zone which has availability_zone at first.
Add a warning to notice users to reduce confusion

Change-Id: I5864c58751ec5f182f30feb302a95923948ad2ad
Closes-Bug: #1644051

added_lines: if availability_zone: metadata = {u'availability_zone': availability_zone} else: metadata = {u'availability_zone': None} try: api.nova.aggregate_set_metadata(request, id, metadata) message = (_('Successfully updated availability_zone for "%s."') % data['name']) messages.success(request, message) except Exception: exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to update the availability_zone.'))

commit_message:
extend retry limit in test_stack_update_with_conditions

Change retry limit from total 20 times retry to 60 times retry.
We will have around 120 seconds waiting time (slept 2 seconds
between each retry).
Closes-Bug: #1737796

Change-Id: I634acf4ff2c204e3ca08b882b30e498228b3f9ba

commit_message:
Ensure mtu is set correctly on ctlplane

We were not passing the MTU when we create the ctlplane network so if
the local_mtu is less than 1500, 1500 is used by the ctlplane network in
neutron.

Change-Id: Ic7a4c5a62ff49b2f8964dd58bf5c97d9781c4ce1
Related-Bug: #1754036

commit_message:
Fix up probetests check on feature/deep

- update the saio sample configs so the sharder tests can run
- add more assertions to try to catch failures earlier
- capture rsync logs

Change-Id: I6cc9e013889da431c95b0058131f76aa920638de
